News & Events

As we are trying hard to engage with the service providers as well as the consumer communities, we have traveled around the globe to promote our cause. We have been present at these following major events and plan more in the near future:

  • Carole Goble presented Biocatalogue: A Curated Web Service Registry for the Life Science Community at the IEEE and Microsoft e-Science conference 2008, Indianapolis, USA (December 2008).
    • Slides: Powerpoint 97-2003 or PDF
  • Semantic Web Applications and Tools for Life Sciences (SWAT4LS) Workshop, e-Science Institute, Edinburgh, Scotland, UK (28 Nov 08).
  • Taverna Tutorial, NERC Oxford, UK (30 Oct 2008).
  • ECCB Interoperability of bioinformatics software and databases tutorial, Sardinia, Italy (22 Sept v08).
  • ECCB Web Services and Workflows tutorial, Sardinia, Italy (22 Sept 2008).
  • FELICS Roadshow: Munich (12 Sept 2008).
  • EBI Hands-on: Programmatic access in Perl: web services & workflows, UK (8-11 Sept 2008).
  • Taverna Tutorial at ECML / PKDD 2008, Antwerp, Belgium (15 Sept 2008).
  • FELICS Roadshow: The Hague, The Netherlands (5 Sept 2008).
  • EMBRACE: Web Services in Systems Biology (28 Aug 2008)
  • EraSysBio Summer School, Tenerife, Spain(28-31 Aug 2008).
  • III Congreso Colombiano de Biotecnolog√≠a (30 Jul - 1 Aug 2008).
  • EBI Hands-on: Programmatic access of Proteomics Resources UK (28-31 July 2008).
  • ISMB 2008, Toronto, Canada (18-23 July 2008).
  • Taverna Training course, University of Cambridge, UK (27-28 May 2008).


Upcoming & Ongoing Events

  • We are participating in the BioMOBY service annotation jamboree (November 2008).
